I know it's early, but happy birthday!
I'm 23 years old, which means that I've grown up a little this year.
I think I'm already an adult, but I want to be more mature.
I would like to be more mature, and I would also like to value my individuality.

And then, little by little, we started to have more opportunities to work together.
When I was asked who I wanted to MC with, the first person that came to mind was Makino-san.

I'm very happy to be able to MC with you this time.

My name is Takamora Oshino of Tsubaki Factory. As I have just announced, I, Takamora Oshino, will graduate from Tsubaki Factory and Hello Project
Tsubaki Factory and Hello Project. I decided to graduate around the time of last year's spring tour, but during this spring tour, I felt that many of the members' personalities were coming out.
I felt that the members' personalities were coming out and I felt that each member was very reliable.
I was able to make the decision to graduate from Hello Project. I love Hello Project and that feeling has never changed.
I am very grateful to the people around me, and I hope to repay them with my performance.

I want it to be a year of expanding possibilities.
Wow, you know, there were a lot of things that caught my attention.

I do a different hairstyle every time, so far.

So I've been doing various hairstyles, and as I search for what kind of hairstyles I like, I'd like to try a hairstyle based on an anime character.
So, when I was looking for various kinds of hairstyles, I thought that if I could do Ami Hinokimori's (the main character) hairstyle, even with my current hair length, I would be able to do it.
I thought I could do it with the same length of hair.
I thought I could do it with the same length, so I did it, and I like it.
It's cute. I don't arrange my hair much.
I don't arrange my hair much.
There's one more thing that's been bothering me. It's a secret that hasn't come out yet.

When they call out the name "Morning Musume。24," all the fans say "24.
It was so funny that I kept saying "24" behind their backs.
The year after the name has been added since 14, so it's been 10 years.
So I remember that when I was 14, I had just joined the company and my senpai called me 14, so I can understand how they feel.
And you mentioned baseball a little bit.
I wanted to go see a live baseball game at least once this year.
Even a live broadcast would be fun.
But do you know the rules of baseball?
I only have a rough idea.
That's why I thought it would be better to start from the beginning.
The live broadcast shows the players you pay attention to, or...

It's hard to understand what's going on from the live broadcast.
So if I watch everything, I can understand what I'm thinking about.
That's what I was going to recommend.
Please watch the live broadcast and learn from it.
Then, if you decide to go to the ballpark next time...
I'll go to the ballpark next time.
I'll be able to say, "Oh, that's the guy I saw on TV.
That's my way of recommending him.
It's more fun to go there with some knowledge than to go there without any knowledge.

The second most stoic member of the group, with eight votes, is Michiyo Hirai of Beyonce's Seasonings.
As Honoka Kobayashi said in her comment, she doesn't use the word "diet" very often, but rather "weight loss.
She is like an athlete, but she has to decide what she wants to eat every day, and she does her best not to eat anything other than what she has decided to eat.
She even calculates the calories and does things that you wouldn't normally do, like deciding on a month's worth of food ahead of time and following that plan.
I think it's really cool that she doesn't compromise on her performance, which is probably why she is able to express her opinions to her seniors.

I'm sorry that other people thought I was being nosy, but I'm just saying, "This is how it's done.

I'm hoping that this song will reach the younger generation without losing the idea that this is the kind of song I'm singing while I'm here.

He still called out to me, and so on.

After the concert, I also asked Mr. Oda to tell me if he noticed anything.

He always does that for me.
I really trust you a lot when it comes to performance and singing.
I have a lot of trust in Mr. Oda when it comes to performance and singing.
During the current tour, he has been helping the younger members who are struggling in terms of singing.
Oda-san was always there to listen to them in detention practice.
Even in the backstage, he would call the struggling singers to come next to him and listen to them all the time.
He would listen to them and give them detailed instructions like, "You're off, you're not right here.
He listened to me as I gave him detailed instructions.
